page.title: 10RELIGION IN THE LYTHE AREA
page.content:
{RELIGION
Religion appears to have always been an important aspect of village life centred round the village church. {St. Oswald's Parish Church:- The church is dedicated to St.Oswald one of the founders of Christianity in Northern England.There is evidence to suggest that there has been a church at Lythe since about 900 A.D. Stones of Anglo-Danish origin are on display at the back of the present church.With the coming of prosperity in the form of the Alum Works in the early 1600s the silver Chalice and Paten were presented to the church.At this time records show that the church was one of the most well attended in the North Riding.The church was extensively restored to its medieval beauty in 1910.
